sentence.Network_en: "Well," he conceded, "I do sometimes mumble a bit."
sentence.Network_cn: “嗯，”他承认道，“我有时候说话的确有点吐字不清。”

sentence.Network_en: He could hear the low mumble of Navarro's voice.
sentence.Network_cn: 他能听到纳瓦罗在小声咕哝。

sentence.Network_en: For goodness'sakes, Lucy Marian, speak up! I can't abide children who mumble.
sentence.Network_cn: 乖乖! 露西?玛丽安, 讲大声一点! 我最讨厌小孩子说话咕咕哝哝的.

going back to language , think about what you make sense of when people speak : they mumble , break all the rules of grammar , slur words and so on .再说回到语言，想想人们说话时你的感觉：他们咕哝、打破所有语法规则、吞音等等。

entry.def: If you mumble, you speak very quietly and not at all clearly with the result that the words are difficult to understand.

example.ex: Her grandmother mumbled in her  sleep...
example.tran: 她祖母含混不清地说着梦话。

means.word_mean: 1. talk indistinctly; usually in a low voice
2. grind with the gums; chew without teeth and with great difficulty;

sentences.sentence: "the old man had no teeth left and mumbled his food"

auth_sentence.content: There may be the occasional mumble that we try to decipher.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: There may be the occasional mumble that we try to decipher.

auth_sentence.content: But will they mumble if their bellies are beginning to growl?
auth_sentence.res_content: But will they mumble if their bellies are beginning to growl?

auth_sentence.content: My mother did not mumble that the policemen were symptoms of a larger malaise.

means.word_mean: 含糊地说某事; 叽咕; 咕哝

sentences.en: He always mumbles when he's embarrassed.
sentences.cn: 他感到难为情时说话就含糊不清了。

sentences.en: He mumbled something to me which I did not quite catch.
sentences.cn: 他对我叽咕了几句话, 可我没太听清楚。

jushi.english: He always mumbles when he's embarrassed.
jushi.chinese: 他感到难为情时说话就含糊不清了。

jushi.english: She mumbled an apology and left.
jushi.chinese: 她嘟嘟囔囔地道了歉就走了。
他含含糊糊地说：“对不起。”
